website_summaries.verdict: A good-quality leather ballet shoe that tends to hold up well over time but is a little wider than some other styles.
pros: These ballet shoes stand out for their comfort, quality, and cute style
Most customers praise the good fit
They also get top marks for durability
Some have even experienced them holding up well with years of use
cons: These tended to have some inconsistencies in terms of sizing
Some also feel they are wider than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Convert "Youth Size" to "Adult Size" before ordering
customer_reviews.text: My daughters have been wearing this type of ballet shoe for years with no complaints. They're comfortable and reasonably good quality. I want to comment on the sizing issue, though. If you're buying for a child who wears a youth size 1 to 4.5 you must convert the size to an adult women's size by going up 2 sizes, otherwise it will be too small. So, for example, my older daughter wears a youth size 4 so she wears a size 6 in these shoes. My younger daughter wears a youth size 3 street shoe, so we order an adult women size 5 for her ballet shoes. Hope this helps someone :)
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Order 2 sizes larger than your child’s street shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful shoe. My daughters ballet masters have asked that the students wear solid leather shoes with solid soles (no split soles) because they strengthen the feet. These are exactly as pictured. My daughter wears a child’s street size 2 (she’s 9 yo) and we ordered the women’s 4. Fit great with a bit of room for growth.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes came earlier than expected and fit very well. I bought my regular shoe size which is 10 and it fits perfectly. The quality is great but the sides kind of stick out when I bend my foot which I assume probably won't affect my dancing but if it does I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ronell Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Too small in length!
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with them. I would not have minded if they were just a tad bit too tight or loose, just for stretching out at home..but they were SO loose on the sides (good if you have wide feet) and a full size too small in the length. I'd like to try to keep them, but just way too small. I will probably go buy some in person in a dance store. I wear a 71/2 and I do not have wide feet. I ordered a 7/12. If I were to order again I would get an 81/2
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I’ve been buying these for the last couple years. They hold up well and can really take a beating. Sizing can be a little difficult because ballet shoes size differently. I’d recommend going up 1 to 2 sizes if they are growing. I bought a 4 and my daughter wears a 2.5 street shoe. There’s a bit of room to grow. Just need to pull the laces tight to stay on the foot. Typically you know and cut the laces short. Since she will be growing in to these, Just going to knot them and trim them so they can be loosened as her feet grow.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: The cortex is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it once, changed it once, and then chose 8.5. Just... Normally, American street shoes have a size of 7, Chinese size is 38, and Italian size is 38 or 37. I think it is different for each brand and different manufacturers. 🦶🏻Try it out before you know that is suitable. The quality is good and the packaging is not bad. The old American brand is very comfortable.Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these for weaving. I am a 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for weaving. I am a 9 1/2 women's in shoe size. I purchased a 10 W. It fit snugly in the toe but not too tight. It gapped slightly but snugged up when I adjusted the cords in front. I have a high instep and the overstrap was not too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A.

customer_reviews.title: Best ballet shoes at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes and very good quality at a great price! Just take your shoe size and order, nothing more easier than that! I am 9 M and these 9 size shoes fit like a glove! Very light, I picked them in pink for my ballet class. They are very comfortable. They are made of leather and synthetic in Thailand. I like the lining that looks like a Liberty fabric. The pre-attached elastic strap can be readjusted in case of. They do not have a right and left and very often dancers invert them to make them last longer as the impact points are different then. Recommended purchase for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: VeroTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Old Fashioned Style
customer_reviews.text: The picture and description implied that the shoe was cut lower over the top of the foot but it comes up to about half the way between the tip of the toe to the ankle. I had purchased the same shoe at a local dance store and was hoping for a more attractive style. I remember having dance shoes in the past that were cut better.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanport-CedarRiver

customer_reviews.title: These work fine
customer_reviews.text: After reading many reviews I ordered up a half size. My street shoe size is 7.5B and I bought these in an 8M. I pulled the strings as tight as I could and wore them with socks. My teacher at first said she would normally order down, not up but decided the 8 is fine for my feet and I wore them to class this week, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing of shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black ballet shoe in size 8. Both shoes were way too big, loose fitting, and the left shoe is noticeably larger than the right shoe. They gap at the sides and are slightly too long in the length. Does not fit like a normal size 8 should. Could not make them work even with thick socks. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love ballet shoes. I made the mistake of ordering too small. I guess I should have went up a size. I thought I had done so and given myself an extra bit. The overall fit is nice. I have to loosen them up to give my big toe a little break. Next time I’ll remember. But for around the house and running errands they work for me. Thank you for the super fast shipping. I so needed them and they came the day before I left for my trip
customer_reviews.author: Hb

customer_reviews.title: made well- love them
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading mixed reviews,but I'm satisfied with these from Capezio. very comfy & true to size- I normally wear a size 9-9 1.5 in street shoes- took the advise on vendors suggestion to go half size up from normal . Felt kinda snug upon first wearing, but after about 2 hours, leather stretched out & they are perfect. will order more if I can find black in leather as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus P.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing can be tricky.
customer_reviews.text: I read through all of the reviews regarding sizing and ultimately settled on my sneaker size 9M. However, I need the 9.5 or possibly 10. Make sure to go with your larger foot's sizing and then consider a half-size up or next size. Everything fit great and the elastic was able to adjust for gaps on the sides; they just weren't long enough and pulled on my big toes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: No arch support
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so light that it feels like I am dancing barefooted. There is no arch support but since they are ballet shoes I didn't expect them to have it. They do have full leather soles which I wanted. I can slide on floors (which I wanted) but I would not be able to wear them for any length of time. I have very narrow feet but to get them long enough I had to sacrifice width even though they do have drawstrings. Time will tell if they hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wear these as shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be well made ballet shoes. They are leather upper and sole with a lining on the inside. I have a wide and regular fit as well. There is an elastic band to adjust the width if they are a little lose on the sides. I wear these on quick trips to the store or doctors appts because it's like wearing socks but with a suede sole. They become more comfortable as I wear them. I chose black because it goes with everything. Great with jeans.
customer_reviews.author: WitchyWoman

customer_reviews.title: Size up two shoe sizes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Remember to size up about two shoe sizes with ballet shoes. The first pair we ordered were way too tight and small. The second pair we ordered (two sizes up) fit perfectly. I've since heard this is common for ballet shoes. The quality is very nice but wish their was a warning or description before ordering to size up. I will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly II

customer_reviews.title: good quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of ballet shoes we bought from Capezio- first one was perfect, and this one is perfect, too. Our daughter wears size 6 1\2 in women's size, last time we bought size 6- she outgrew them fast... I sized up and bought size 7- with a little (really little ) room to grow- and we are happy. They fit nicely and do not scrunch her toes.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Effective - both practical and cost wise!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, for whatever reason, is rough on her shoes for dance - so, these were very effective from both a cost point of view and comfort / practicality. They run a little small to true size, at least that was our experience, but, my daughter likes them and says they are very comfortable to her, so I am happy with that. I will definitely purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: 0REDSOX7

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a size 4, 4.5 or occasionally 5 depending on brand. She has long skinny feet not wide at all. These were very tight on her. We just returned to get a 5 and I’m hoping that that does it. We gave to a friend to try who is generally a 4-4.5 and they were also very snug on her. I would definitely order 1/2 a size up maybe even a little more if you have a wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Finley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Accurate Fit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the black, but only pink was available in my size. The pink shoes are made of a softer, more pliable, leather than the black slippers; those ordering black might want to order a half size larger. If I were using these slippers for ballet, I would order a half size smaller. However, I found that ballet slippers are perfect for exercising on the Nordic Track and welcomed the looser fit. All in all, I have found the current sizing to be more accurate than Capezio slipper sizing in the past, I also appreciate the slippers coming with the elastic already sewn on.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Ivey

customer_reviews.title: I found a good excuse to get these slippers
customer_reviews.text: These classic powder pink slippers bring back memories of my taking ballet lessons when I was a little girl, and I wanted a good excuse to get them! Sadly, I didn't grow up to be a ballerina, but I did go to the YMCA and found Y-Barre and Moving for Balance classes, and these shoes work well there. (Sturdier "trainers" are needed for some of the other group exercise classes, though.) I have balance problems due to the common problem of "Morton's Foot" and it was easy to slip a pair of Posture Dynamics "Solemate "Stick On" Microlifts inside each slipper.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Athena

customer_reviews.title: True to size, sturdy dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: Capezio makes the best ballet shoes. They are a little firmer in the sole than others, and the daisy pattern lining is a nice touch. They fit perfectly; I wear a 9.5 street shoe and ordered a 9.5. The leather is high quality and they are comfortable and perfectly hug my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one and a half sizes up and the length heel to big tow is still short. I usually wear 8.5 and ordered a 10 wide. The width however is too wide in the arch area and while I have the elastic fully stretched to keep the shoe on, it is too tight around my foot. If it were not for COVID I would return these. Next time I would order 2 full sizes up and get the regular fit not wide. Stick with bloch.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: House Slippers
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful slippers. My wife wears them as house shoes and loves them. They also look great with most clothing. I have purchased 3-4 pairs for her over the years. These (unlike all Capezio's) are pretty much a perfect fit as described, very soft and comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: size is totally wrong
customer_reviews.text: the quality is great, but only for a show size 2 sizes smaller than my own. I double checked their size chart, and although it says I should be wearing this size, it is clearly an error. sad because I really wanted them!
customer_reviews.author: Maracapozzi

customer_reviews.title: Order larger, at least a half size up
customer_reviews.text: I first bought the 8.5 first because that's my shoe size but it was painfully small, fit like a glove with no toe room at all. The reviews advised a full size up so I ordered the 9.5. This one is too big but at least I can tighten the ties and keep them from flopping around. This purchase was not for use in dance but with a costume so it will suit me.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Coryat

customer_reviews.title: Not using them for dance, but they’re awesome
customer_reviews.text: I’m no longer a dancer, sadly. I’m supposed to wear house shoes indoors, but those are always too hot and ever since the stroke all of the ones I’ve tried trip me up. I thought I might have better luck with ballet slippers, and I did! These are a perfect substitute for house shoes; they work well with my physical therapy AND they don’t make me feel like a frumpy little old lady.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Great ballet shoes, got size too big!
customer_reviews.text: Love these ballet shoes, but from some reviews they said to go two sizes up. I decided to go half size up only and in medium, from my daughters street shoes and it was way too big. So I had to order a half size smaller than her street shoes, honestly, sames size would do too, but I got narrow this time. Let’s hope the new ones fit! Fingers crossed!
customer_reviews.author: Rita C.

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. I wear a size 71/2 and I ordered a size 8. I would definitely go up to a size 8 1/2. They run a little small. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Order in your current shoe size!
customer_reviews.text: Great ballet shoes! After reading mixed reviews about the fit/size, I was unsure how to proceed. I ordered the shoes 1 size up and they were too large. I exchanged them for a pair in my shoe size, and they are a perfect fit. So order in your current shoe size for best results!
customer_reviews.author: Leah McClain

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe
customer_reviews.text: They are good shoes. I just am between sizes in Capezio shoes. I would suggest going to a dance store to get fitted by a professional. You never know how a ballet slipper is going to fit your foot. Capezio is a great brand. Just not for my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Kitsunefoxglove

customer_reviews.title: Great Dance flats
customer_reviews.text: Great ballet shoe for salsa dance class. After a while in heels, or for more grounded movements you may want to take off your heels but still be able to spin and protect your feet. Had I ordered a larger size, they'd be too big. But as they are perfect, they do need a bit more breaking in to relax the leather more and conform to my feet. The leather is soft but haven't conformed to my feet yet. No, I do not understan the question regarding arch support. It's a ballet shoe. Ballet shoes have zero arch support.
customer_reviews.author: E Williams

customer_reviews.title: Order a size up, no question
customer_reviews.text: I wear a firm 8.5 in street shoes and I ordered an 8.5 in these slippers. I should have heeded the other reviews-- the shoes were painfully too small. I reordered the slippers in 9.5 (and a $5 difference increase in price) and hope they will fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I workout. I play just dance for an hour everyday to get my exercise and they have served me well they do wear out after a few months but they are comfortable and flexible
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Stone

customer_reviews.title: Capezio Women's Daisy Ballet Shoe, Pink - REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, attractive. They ran small and narrow. For me, I would order one size larger, and perhaps a little wider. I wear them with a thin sock. I will order again. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Going through the reviews I decided to order these Capezio black leather ballet slippers true to size. I normally wear a 91/2 - 10 women, narrow in shoes and sandals so I ordered a 10 narrow in this item. The width is perfect but the 10 is borderline tight. Not toe jamming tight but my toe is at the very top of the slipper. No room to grow...lol (joke I'm an adult). I will not be returning them due to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my normal size and they were too big so I returned them. If you can figure out the right size, they're a good deal, but I think I'd need to repurchase them in-store to try them on.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Capezio Women's Daily Ballet Shoe, Black, 7.5 M US...
customer_reviews.text: Nice ballet slippers for comfortable use around the house and for dancing...They run a bit wide, and are a bit hard to adjust to foot width, but that could just be me...After a few wearings I DID notice a leathery smell, so I stopped wearing them, as stinky feet are NOT on my lits fo FAVORITE things!
customer_reviews.author: Tina the S.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 1/2 medium. I ordered a 10 W/ hey are certainly wide enough, but they are too short. A total waste of money for me. As they are leather, I wore them twice in an attempt to stretch them. Nope. Can't dance in a tight shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Thea

customer_reviews.title: A Great Ballet Shoe
customer_reviews.text: The studio where both of my daugthers dance at requires all dancers wear this brand. These ballet shoes hold up great after countless hours of wear. They do stretch slightly and I have always found I need to order a half to a full size larger than their current street shoe size. I've been buying these for over 5 years straight and have always had to size up. I love purchasing these through Amazon because they are often much more expensive at the local dance supply store. Amazon makes it super easy to return or exchange for a different size.
customer_reviews.author: JMN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dance slippers
customer_reviews.text: I bought size 10 wide. I’m normally a 10 1/2 shoe. They fit perfectly! I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: real leather
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be the best on today's market, but not made as good when I bought many many years ago for my young daughter taking ballet lessons. Some pieces on today ballet slipper have been replaced with fabric were they use to be all leather
customer_reviews.author: Ms M A Smith

customer_reviews.title: as a 21yr old ballet beginner, these shoes are exactly what I was lookin for..
customer_reviews.text: i was worried that the shoes would be too small after reading all the reviews, but i did what a few others did and they are an exact fit. I measured my foot and it is 9" when I looked up a size chart it said 9" in would be 6 1/2. I have very narrow feet so I got the 6 1/2N to be exact. These shoes are close to my toes and not too tight. They really help me find my balance and turn out when I practice with them. The shipping was seedy and the inside lining is so adorable. :)
customer_reviews.author: alex vicencio

customer_reviews.title: Too much toe material
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for me. Size, length wise, was correct. I wear a street shoe of an 8 and the 8 fit. HOWEVER, there was a HUGE amount of excess material to the side of the toes. I know that ballet shoes do not have a left/right orientation and to expect some excess but these had too much(almost 2 finger widths of excess material) and I would consider my toes to be of normal proportion. The quality of the shoe was as I expected. Nice ballet pink color with nice leather sole. They were comfortable other than the excess material. Requested refund!
customer_reviews.author: CPhillips

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Costume Party
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great for a costume party. I was able to dance in them and my feet felt great the next day. I wouldn't wear them outside on pavement (soft, leather bottoms) but for inside a hotel lobby and dance floor, they were perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Eggface

customer_reviews.title: Jjust what we needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 13 year old daughter for dance class. She has always worn jazz shoes rather than ballet, so I was unsure what size to get. She wears an 8W in street shoes and tap shoes, so I ordered the 8M (since reviews said they run wide). The shoes fit perfectly once the tie is pulled tighter and will serve their purpose. The leather does seem a bit thinner than my younger daughter's ballet shoes, but for the price, we are pleased. I am sure they will be even more comfortable as they mold to her foot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: I got my daughter a foot and a half bigger then I usually do and it was extremely tight. I would recommend getting a bigger size if u buy
customer_reviews.author: erica k.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So cute and comfortable. I ordered this for home workouts and a class I go 2 once-3 times a week that includes ballet moves. I am a street size 7 and my feet are kind of narrow. It fit great though. As soon as I wore them I thought they were for wider feet but I pulled the strings in the front and it pulled the shoe around my foot to a perfect fit which I really liked. It felt like it was customized just for me. I am so glad it adjusts and I won't have to return it. Make sure you tighten the bow in the front and order your street size and you will be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Wide
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. They were bought for my daughter who wears a 7 1/2. We ordered the 7 1/2 shoe, they fit in length but the width is crazy big.
customer_reviews.author: Mao T Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Maybe just a flawed pair.
customer_reviews.text: I need these shoes right away, or I may have returned them. Strap that goes over the foot is sew on too far to the heel. So it fits funny and gaps open. I have ordered these shoes before and they were amazing. Comfortable and easy to clean. I hate high heels (ouch) so I chose to wear ballet slippers instead.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J. Brussow

customer_reviews.title: all shoes are not made equal
customer_reviews.text: Fit true to size but too wide. Narrow is too tight and wide is too wide on the sides. Looks baggy but could just be my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne Francis

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Won't order ballet shoes online anymore. They are too small. I ordered two different sizes and they both look like and fit the same way. They didn't Fit cuz they were too small.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: a tad bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Overall, fits as expected, but a little on the larger side. My daughter typically wears a 10.5, but a 10 would have been a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Quality dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that the elastic band on the shoes is already attached. When I first started dancing, the elastic was not attached and you had to sew in the band adjusting the position of the band to the arch of your foot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Clarke

customer_reviews.title: I chose it in a wide size for a better fit for her
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted to take ballet classes, so, I chose this shoe because it was required that she have pink leather shoes. I chose it in a wide size for a better fit for her. They looked a little big, but, when she tightened the laces, they fit well. This was my first experience with ballet shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Decent ballet slippers
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these for years, and they always fit as they should and last well. My last pair was dying at 15 years. It was time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 1 size bigger But these are small and Wide
customer_reviews.text: My normal size is 9 and sometimes a 9 1/2 I have a narrow foot, so I ordered 10 N. I am not a Dancer, I want these to keep stickers off my feet in the yard at home. My toe rubs the end of the shoe, which may be what a dancer wants. But the shoe gaps open along the sides. When I pull the elastic bow, the shoe tightens up, but it also pulls the shoe shorter! So I guess if I had a size 13 N, I could make it work! So disappointing! If companies insist on making shoes run small, they need to at least offer larger sizes - - maybe even size 15????
customer_reviews.author: Sundown

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sister and they were too large for her. She's a size ten. I'm a size 11. I tried to wear them and they were too tight. Hmm.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Gaal

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for myself. I've restarted ballet doing DVD classes at home. These are perfect!! I wanted a bit of cushioning under my foot which these have and they are very good quality for the price. I am usually a 7-7.5 and I read other reviews and went for the seven M. It was slightly tight on the left foot but as they are leather it has only taken a week for them to stretch. My feet are wide at the toe and the medium is perfect. I understand what someone else says about the toes overhanging the sole of the shoe but it's not bothering me. I couldn't be happier with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. T. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Ballet Slippers
customer_reviews.text: I wear my ballet slippers in the summer. They are a perfect compliment to my cotton dresses. And I get rave reviews in the supermarket aisles.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Johnson-James

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: So these were for my 13 year old daughter. She's in a 9 Ariat boot, a 9.5 athletic shoe, but a 10 in these! She doesn't wear them super tight like a sock, but her feet are narrow and she pulls the string to get a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for yoga because I don't like being barefoot in class and socks slide. After reading reviews, I was uncertain which size to order since I wear size 8 in flats, 8.5 in heels, and 9.5 in my tennis shoes. I decided to choose the only size missing, size 9. They fit great! A little snug around my big toe, but everything else fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: I am so so happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. they fit like a glove. I was looking for flats for my wedding. I am really tall and have big feet. I ordered these and had them sent to my friend who packaged up all my purchases and shipped them to me for my Wedding Day. Where I am at right now there are no shoes within a 50 mile radius that has shoes my size (Womans 10 Medium). I tried them on and did not want to take them off! the leather is so soft. They make my feet look smaller. They are really comfortable. Of Course Capezio is a good brand. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Dena R. Uzunkaya

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Lasted less than a month. Fit is very small. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen's Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect basic ballet shoe
customer_reviews.text: I found the fit perfect and the shoe comfortable. Nice shoe for the price. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: GF4Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit just as expected; the size was large on my foot but fit perfectly with the elastic adjustments. I am actually using them for a costume and need to break them in for maximum comfort. I have been dancing around, rolling them, and wearing them at work for about a day now and they are becoming quite comfortable already. I cannot speak to how well they work for their intended purpose as I have not taken ballet classes in over 10 years but from my inexperience and intended use, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and fit great!
customer_reviews.text: Great ballet shoes... pretty flowers on the inside. My daughter has narrow feet so getting this size worked great. True to size. She wears an 8.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fit is perfect if you remember to order a size smaller than ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect if you remember to order a size smaller than your usual size. The shoes are made with quality materials and give excellent support, this is important to me since I have neuropathy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: sizing review
customer_reviews.text: Sizing tip - I always wear either an 8 or 8 1/2 medium shoe size. I ordered these in 8 1/2 and they are a bit short. I would order in a 9 next time. I believe they will stretch to be comfortable in time but I am going to have to go through a break-in period that I would prefer not to have to do because I hate to have my toe scrunched. Otherwise - very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Look like you've dance a million shows after a few days in class as a 3 year old...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H.

customer_reviews.title: Order half size bigger
customer_reviews.text: I will recommend to order half size bigger. I ordered 7.5W and had to go back and order 8W. They fit perfect now.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Rivera

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 10 M and it fits snug but comfortable. I'm a 10 M in street size to so I was so happy they fit right. These ballet shoes also are very easy to wash with water ( On the outside ). I LOVE THESE.(: couldn't be more happy
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Stallman

customer_reviews.title: Needs more toe area room, otherwise adorable.
customer_reviews.text: These Capezio Women's Daisy Ballet Shoes are adorable. Problem is they were to short for my big toes. I tried going up a size, but that didn't work either. So I am putting heavy winter socks, slipping into the shoes and using the hair dryer on hot to span the shoe (the sides closest to the front and the front) in the hopes of expanding the toe fronts). Sure hope this works as the shoes are so pretty, and I want to wear them as morning-up slippers.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hembree

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The fit was off - small. The lining on the inside of the left shoe was tucked and uncomfortable. It was stitched incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: DeeP

customer_reviews.title: They run a half size smaller then street shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these Ballet shoes. They are a half size bigger then her steet shoes that are under armor. My daughter wears size 5 in street shoes and wears size 5.5 in ballet shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amie h

customer_reviews.title: excellent ballet shoe
customer_reviews.text: 8 1/2, black, true to size, quality leather and elastic strap already sewn on perfect ballet slipper
customer_reviews.author: pen💮

customer_reviews.title: Runs small go up about 2 sizes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a kids size 2 US size ordered a size 5 adult for her the fit was perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm an "old" ballerina and have just started barre workouts at home. I wear a size 6 1/2 to 7 shoe and my feet are fairly narrow. These slippers fit perfectly with the string adjustment. Really enjoy wearing them in the house as it's a constant reminder to get up on my toes and walk around...
customer_reviews.author: Sue Henry

customer_reviews.title: the length is good, but they are maybe for a thicker foot
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 9 as I'm usually an 81/2 and in dance shoes that size fits tight...so I went to a 9 and these gap a little, the elastic helps to tighten them..the length is good, but they are maybe for a thicker foot? I am not a dancer, bought them for a play costume..work fine and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: art detective

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ballet
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, these are my "go to" for all the years my daughters have been in dance! Great customer service from seller.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ballet Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter and we are very happy with the comfort and quality. I bought them big so she will be able to wear for two years.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J Felmlee

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like my old capezio Ballet slippers
customer_reviews.text: No heel or toe reinforcements, don,t even look like picture....might last a few weeks
customer_reviews.author: Sheenaz

customer_reviews.title: Runs more than 1/2 size too short
customer_reviews.text: These are nice ballet shoes - but i ordered a half size larger than I normally wear (width is adjustable with encased elastic string), anyway, the shoes really are tight against the tip of my big toe - normally I'd return them but I need them now so I am hoping spraying them with "Shoe Stretch" will help to make a more comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire Seamaid

customer_reviews.title: These work great! They fit well and I haven't had to ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't dance as much as I used to, so I was just looking for some simple shoes for when I teach classes. These work great! They fit well and I haven't had to adjust the elastic or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Goedjv96

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you like to go around the house barefoot!
customer_reviews.text: I love barefoot, but sometimes it's not clean or practical! These are great. Don't get too large, the leather has "give" and will conform to your feet. The little bow is elastic and you can tighten and narrow by pulling it.
customer_reviews.author: Cavy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: They are lovely, high-end ballet slippers. They arrive wrapped with tissue inside a nice gift box, and importantly, arrive with the strap already attached unlike other brands. They do run a tad wide, I might have been able to wear the 8M instead of the 8-1/2M, but all and all, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CLS

customer_reviews.title: Size 2.5 = size 4
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was squeezing into size 2.5's. I measured her feet at a shoe store = size 4.5. She fits into 5's. I bought size 4 because she likes dancing shoes snug (and the 2.5's still kind of fit). The 4's are exactly the same size as the 2.5's! She tried them side by side. We measure them. Triple checked the size marking inside the shoes. I'm crossing my fingers that a size 5pair will be different.
customer_reviews.author: Holly S Edson

customer_reviews.title: ... for over 4 years and still looks in very good condition. The leather has not worn out but ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pair of leather flats for over 4 years and still looks in very good condition. The leather has not worn out but a bit faded at the toe area. It's good for another 4 years at the very minimum if not more. I only buy Capezio flats for my ballet classes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Tan

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I like Capezio daisy ballet shoes, but I ordered 1/2 size up from street shoe for one daughter and a whole size up for my other daughter. Both shoes were too small. Very little size consistency. We will re-order again. ☹️ Hopefully the next set fits...
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter usually wear a size 7 and this fits her well. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: DeB

customer_reviews.title: 5 wide and they fit perfect. However
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 9 regular shoe. Size 8.5 was too small. I exchanged for a 9.5 wide and they fit perfect. However, I do not normally wear ballet shoes and got these for a costume. Maybe for ballet they are supposed to fit tight and pinch your toes:( Cute when they fit.
customer_reviews.author: love it

customer_reviews.title: Inner sole is too flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Interior bottom sole is a thin cotton cloth layer which didn't last very long, I wore it only a few times before it started coming off/apart. I had bought the same pair of slipper years ago that had leather inner sole which lasted for years, I guess they just don't make them like they used to anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Yu

customer_reviews.title: Magic Slippers
customer_reviews.text: Before my daughter got these, she was very clumsy. Now she is dancing professionally. They changed her life. I am so proud.
customer_reviews.author: FES 3

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love that wider sizes are offered and easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm typically a size 7 or 7.5 and I have longer toes and these shoes fit perfectly! They are soft and already have the straps sewn on. The color is a light pink without a lot of beige.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I recently signed up for an adult ballet class. It has been years since I've taken classes, so I had to order new slippers. I have always worn capezio slippers so I was shocked to find how much the quality deteriorated. The leather is paper thin. In fact, I have a hard time believing it is leather! I ordered the Daisy model, maybe I should have ordered the Tekniks, which is what I used to wear. I suppose for my purpose, these are fine, but they are REALLY flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, Functional
customer_reviews.text: After reading others reviews, I took a leap of faith and ordered my street shoe size, the ballet shoe was perfect in length, but very loose in width. This being my first pair of ballet shoes, or perhaps not being properly fit for shoes before? I'd no idea my foot was so slim. After tightening the lace at the toe, the shoe fits well and works quite well for my purposes. I'd recommend for others such as myself, not professional dancers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alps

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The shoes themselves are really good. Just order 1 1/2 or 2 sizes up to get a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Great for Barre Workout!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made ballet shoes that fit perfectly. You can't go wrong with Capezio I use these to do a barre workout and really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Girl

product_meta.title: Capezio Women's Daisy Ballet Shoe
product_meta.description:
You'll love every minute of wearing Capezio's Daisy ballet shoe. The leather shoe features a lightly padded footbed, a split-suede sole for ultimate flexibility, and a pre-attached elastic strap keeps your foot snug and in place.

Salvatore Capezio was born in 1871 in Muro Lucano, Italy. Uninterested in following in his father's footsteps as a construction engineer, he became an artist of his own right, a cobbler. In 1887, at the age of 17, he opened his shop on Broadway and 39th Street, diagonally across from the old Metropolitan Opera House in New York City. Soon, the shop became a meeting place for dancers who would stop by to discuss their needs and to get a pair of his shoes. As Capezio's popularity grew, dancers from around the world made it a point to visit him and purchase his shoes. The innovation of the products that Salvatore Capezio created and the camaraderie he shared with the dancers molded the direction that his company would follow. In this image, the Capezio brand was established to promote and recognize ongoing achievements and participation in dance. Capezio products remain in the forefront in quality and in technological advances with innovations like the split-sole, the stretch-insert, the Dansneaker and the Tapsneaker. Capezio believes that their success is dependent upon the individual commitment of each customer to continually set new standards of creativity and performance, while preserving a reputation for dependability and distinction. Capezio pledges their support and dedication to the advancement of dance, theater and recreation in communities worldwide. Begin 1 - 1 1/2 sizes up from street shoe size
feature_bullets: Constructed of soft leather upper and Full chrome tanned suede leather outsole for durability.
Daisy print on cotton lining and sock lining or unisex non-print lining for black and white slipper
Hammered pleats for smooth floor contact
Bar-tacked elastic drawstring and 5/8" Pre-attached criss-cross elastics.
Begin with street shoe size. This shoe runs wide
